body.p: is a collaboration solution that is flexible and intuitive, making it suitable for any type of workflow used by a collaborative team during the documentation review process. It provides a platform where a writer can upload documents that need to be reviewed in the form of a review task, the reviewers can access the documents in a browser where they can review the content, add comments, or contribute changes. They can communicate with each other directly from the interface and ultimately, the task owner has access to a built-in Merge tool to automatically integrate all the changes back into Oxygen XML Editor/Author.

The Content Fusion projects support allows you to connect to an existing Git repository that has a DITA project as its source. Users with a Content Fusion Author role can create review tasks inside a project and reviewers' suggestions are tracked on a dedicated branch in the Git repository. You can also build and configure deliverables for creating PDF or WebHelp output. Additionally, Content Fusion projects allow authors to make changes across multiple files and then commit them to the project.
